results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Futurae is one of the fastest growing Swiss Cybersecurity companies that offers secure and effortless customer access. Futurae’s solutions enable seamless 2FA with fallbacks, compliant transaction confirmations, secure helpdesk authentication, and anything in between. Our customers include well-known companies, such as the Swiss stock exchange, Santander, and Swisscom, to name a few.

Join our international and fast-paced team with experienced industry leaders hard at work shaping the future of online authentication and transaction signing. Futurae operates in financial services and insurances with increasing exposure in other industries.

What you'll do

In this position, you will be responsible for building up the French-speaking market by converting qualified leads into loyal customers. To achieve this you will be talking and consulting stakeholders across a target organization ranging from business, IT, the security and risk officers, all the way to C-level executives. Strong communication skills, stakeholder management capabilities, and an entrepreneurial spirit are necessary.

Responsibilities

  • Convince and win well-known large companies for our outstanding SaaS platform
  • Build and maintain a healthy sales pipeline and accompany leads on their way to the conclusion of a contract
  • Successfully match the needs of the acquired prospects with our offerings, develop proposals, and precisely express Futurae’s USP
  • Excel at establishing strong relationships with decision makers, influencers, and senior executives
  • Collaborate with Futurae teammates (sales development representatives, security solution engineers, customer success) to ensure customer success
  • Increase the conversion pace of qualified leads driving faster sales growth

Requirements

What you will bring

  • 4-6 years of B2B experience - preferably with a SaaS or enterprise software background
  • Experience to consistently meet or exceed goals and objectives
  • Ability to communicate, present and influence effectively at all levels of an organization
  • Excellent team player with strong coaching, mentoring and people management skills
  • Proven ability to work with stakeholders at all levels from engineering to management and navigating the buying center
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Fluent in English and French
  • Ability to lead multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process

Bonus points

  • Experience with Identity and Access Management products and solutions
  • Existing network in business and IT within the financial, insurance and or ecommerce industries in the French-speaking market

Benefits

  • Futurae Stock Options
  • Yearly personal learning & development budget
  • Apple Laptop and equipment for work purposes
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Work at the forefront of an inspiring, dynamic company in the B2B space in the area of user authentication
  • Be part of our friendly, knowledge-sharing, entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchy
  • Work in a role that lets you learn and gives you responsibility and independence

Find out more about Futurae careers at: https://www.futurae.com/careers/

At Futurae we encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, disability, etc.

By sending your application you allow Futurae to handle and store your data.

results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Telco Experts Senior Account Manager Job Description

Telco Experts is a Voice and Data Telecommunications provider as well as a full-service consulting firm serving the business community with a passion for connecting people with what matters with integrity and compassion. The team of 20 employees are based out of 110 Wall Street in New York, NY and are mostly remote.

Position Summary

We are looking for a Senior Account Manager who will be able to think strategically, roll up their sleeves and dig into the data but also able to zoom out and work with the customer on the big picture as well. You will own relationships with our top customers and collaborate cross-functionally with the team to ensure our customers consistently receive first-class service. Our ideal candidate is passionate about using analytical skills to identify problems, find solutions, and improve relationships.

This position can be fully remote (preferable that you are in Central or Eastern time zone) and will pay a competitive salary ($70-80k) and a wide array of benefits including medical benefits and 401k matching programs. The position will start ASAP.

Objectives of this Role

  • Own overall relationship with assigned clients, which includes managing on-boarding, implementation, training, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and high levels of customer satisfaction
  • Establish a trusted and strategic advisor relationship to help drive continued value of our products and services
  • Maintain and develop customer success strategies and best practices, as well as customer support content
  • Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management to understand customer needs, maximize retention and growth, and communicate learnings
  • Maintain existing customer success metrics and data as directed

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

  • Serve as day-to-day contact for assigned accounts, building trust and rapport while identifying areas of opportunity, highlighting best practices, and documenting them
  • Review the customer journey, identifying how it's supported, taking a consultative approach in helping clients overcome issues and achieve goals
  • Plan and lead quarterly strategic business reviews with our top customers
  • Collaborate, problem solve, and/or strategize upcoming client meetings with team members
  • Prepare necessary documentation or visuals for client to demonstrate performance of campaigns; analyze trends in CNPS scores to identify areas of improvement
  • Identify cross-sell opportunities within the base by analyzing customer data
  • Work with the sales team to drill customer references and develop case studies

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 2+ years of experience in sales, account management, or customer success
  • Strong verbal and written communication, strategic planning, and project management skills
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset; organized
  • Comfortable working across multiple departments in a deadline-driven environment
  • Active team player, self-starter, and multitasker who can quickly adjust priorities
  • Energized by a high-growth environment and opportunity for increased responsibility
  • Spirit of continuous improvement to implement new processes
  • Experience with CRM (Hubspot experience a plus)
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Applications with strong Excel skills
  • Telecom experience preferred

results.title: Account Executive, Federal
results.description:
Acquia empowers the world’s most ambitious brands to create digital customer experiences that matter. With open source Drupal at its core, the Acquia Digital Experience Platform (DXP) enables marketers, developers, and IT operations teams at thousands of global organizations to rapidly compose and deploy digital products and services that engage customers, enhance conversions, and help businesses stand out.

Headquartered in the U.S., Acquia has been named a top software company by The Software Report, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named a top place to work by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!

As the Account Executive - Federal, you will...

  • Identify new business opportunities, manage, and close deals in Acquia’s Federal account and prospect base
  • Engage with senior level executives within these organizations
  • Develop positive relationships and identify prospect needs at all decision-making levels
  • Stay current on competitor offerings and be able to identify their strengths and vulnerabilities
  • Turn client feedback into meaningful strategies to drive new business and address competitive risks
  • Influence client decisions and advocate for client needs to broker win-win solutions
  • Work closely with various functional teams including Product Development, Account Management and Project Management teams to ensure seamless implementation and effective ongoing account growth
  • Handle full-life cycle sales in an individual contributor environment
  • Collaborate efficiently across internal teams and nurture an atmosphere of trust and open communication
  • Engage with our channel partners and various subject matter specialists to drive sales opportunities.
  • Travel to client meetings as needed
  • Work cross-functionally with demand generation and marketing teams to nurture pipeline

You’ll enjoy this role if you are/have…

  • Intellectual agility and an ambitious attitude; demonstrates drive, initiative, energy and sense of urgency in acquiring and serving clients
  • Ability to learn and absorb new products quickly and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands
  • Hard-working, results-oriented, upbeat, and has regularly out-performed their peers
  • Looking for daring career growth
  • Passion, drive, and creativity

What you’ll need to be successful...

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Consistent track record of selling into the Federal space
  • Strong sales/client origination experience, preferably with CMS experience
  • Experience negotiating large strategic deals including all phases of client development: prospecting, proposal development, negotiation and ongoing relationship management
  • Experience and the know-how to work in a start-up, fast paced technology environment
  • Strong understanding of the SaaS business model for solutions delivery
  • Confident presentation skills, and must have 'presence' in front of the C-suite customer with the communications skills to articulate a value proposition to a wide range of organizational and functional levels

Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.




Interested residents of Colorado may contact NA-recruiting@acquia.com as it relates to regulation C.R.S. § 8-5-201. Information regarding benefits are linked here.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Mod Op is a full-service advertising agency in search of an Account Manager who is looking for growth and opportunity. At Mod Op you’ll work with internationally-recognized clients who represent a wide range of industries. You'll contribute to projects that propel brands to new heights. You'll collaborate with a team of committed, motivated, and enthusiastic coworkers who see career development and personal development as intertwined. And, thanks to ongoing growth-by-acquisition directed by our former-venture-capitalist CEO and our team of industry leaders, Mod Op offers a compensation package that includes access to low-cost, high-quality benefits, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, and a generous time off policy. Remote and flexible work arrangements are available based on role.

This position performs a combination of duties mainly related to leveraging Mod Op’s expertise and offerings to positively impact our clients’ business objectives. In conjunction with their supervisor, the Account Manager leads and supervises the planning and execution of all marketing communication activities on assigned accounts. He or she contributes in strategic areas and actively encourages the same from all members of the team. The position requires someone who is detail-oriented, poised, confident and proactive with exceptional communications and client service skills.

Job Responsibilities

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients with responsibility for managing the planning and execution of marketing communications activities
  • Be the expert on Client and Agency business and understand as much as possible about the customer
  • Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to client needs and objectives
  • Clearly and consistently communicates to internal and external team members
  • Evaluate, analyze, report on program effectiveness based on key metrics and make recommendations for optimization
  • Assist supervisor with strategic development, program measurement and optimization recommendations
  • Serve as a trusted, reliable resource for clients
  • Be proactive, anticipate and solve problems

In addition, a top priority is contributing to the success of our clients as well as contributing to the creative and collaborative culture of the agency.

Requirements

Required Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Four to six years of related work experience

 

Supervisory ResponsibilityThis position manages the client relationship(s) and is responsible for the internal team that services that client(s).

 

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the “core” work hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and must work at least 40 hours each week to maintain full-time status.

 

 

Preferred Education and Experience

  • Experience across multiple marketing communications disciplines – specifically creative, social media, web and media
  • Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to be resourceful
  • Planning and project management
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Analytical skills

 

 

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

 

None

 

 

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Benefits

  • Health and Life Insurance for employee and family, access to Vision benefits, Telemedicine services, Psychology support and others.
  • On the job training and career growth opportunities
  • Fully remote job
  • Great team environment, collaborative offices, fun company culture with a great balance of work and play
  • Vacations are granted by day or weeks according to employee approved request.
  • Salary with yearly review and competitive benefits
  • Pay commensurate and competitive based on experience and skill set.

When asked what they love about working at Mod Op, we hear:

  • “I feel I can be myself at work and it’s fun!” -MV
  • “The caliber of the clients/brands we work with, knowing your work is seen by
  • thousands of people, in many cases across the world.” -JC
  • “We actually create videogames!” -AC
  • “We have an all-star team, and it’s like playing in the pro-bowl every day!” -MW
  • “Opportunities to always learn from and work with the best and the brightest.” HW
  • “Mentors and opportunities for growth.” -KB

Mod Op believes in teamwork, client collaboration, powerful storytelling, stunning design, and thoughtful problem-solving. Our clients represent a breadth of industries, and every project presents new and interesting challenges. We would love for you to join us!

results.title: Sales Account Manager
results.description:

Responsibilities

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Cloudsmith is looking for an exceptional full-time New Business Account Executive to work remotely. If you are hungry, nimble, and intelligent - with the ability and willingness to nurture leads and close business, we are looking for you.

 

Cloudsmith is a leader in software supply chain management. Allowing organizations to manage software via the cloud, eliminating the need to hire dedicated support staff to handle expensive and unwieldy on-premises solutions.

 

Our artifact management platform helps teams secure their software supply chain by providing a single place to store all their software assets. We provide a place to collect all the

  • external dependencies your team ingests,
  • custom software packages you create,
  • containers (eg Docker images)
  • Terraform modules
  • Helm charts (for container orchestration)

 

We help you control and manage these assets, automatically scan for vulnerabilities and malware, and improve your development team’s productivity.

You will be responsible for engaging and qualifying inbound leads, developing them into sales-qualified opportunities, and growing new business.

We are looking to expand our sales team and bring the value of our cloud-native offering to organizations.

 

About You, The Ideal Candidate

  • You are the customer’s champion. At Cloudsmith we aim to serve our customers by managing expectations and delivering what we promise.
  • You're entrepreneurial-minded. Enjoying the challenge of expanding new territory and having the ability in building a land-and-expand strategy.
  • You’re passionate about selling and technology and open to learning new things.
  • A team player. You understand selling is a team effort and partnering with your sales engineering counterparts is the path to success.
  • A skilled negotiator with the ability to quickly identify the right solutions that meet the customers’ needs to create a win-win situation.
  • You are skilled at driving projects in a startup environment with minimal guidance and limited resources while having the freedom and creativity to continue moving forward. You roll up your sleeves and drive execution and results.
  • You love to share a better way that you believe in with others as you know it will enrich their careers.
  • You exude the qualities and core values of Cloudsmith: loving automation, striving for simplicity, teaching others, and being humble.

 

In short, your qualities:

1. Smart. �

2. Gets Things Done �

3. An Awesome Human Being. �

 

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for qualifying inbound leads (MQLs) and developing them into sales-qualified opportunities.

  • Proactively engage with prospects and follow up with clients to meet their needs.
  • Nurture qualified leads and drive to conversion.
  • Develop an active and vibrant pipeline equal to 3x quota.
  • Offer initial solution overview and help identify customer goals/challenges.
  • Develop excellent relationships with potential and existing clients.
  • Performing research on accounts to help increase interest in the organization and our commercial offerings.
  • Prepare activity reports and update and maintain Salesforce.com.
  • Assist sales management in conveying customer needs to the marketing and technical support team.
  • Provide quotes, proposals, and support to senior sales.
  • Take ownership of rescheduling any postponed meetings and prompt follow-up of inbound inquiries.
  • Other responsibilities as needed.

 

Experience

  • Demonstrated success in meeting sales goals with a solid track record.
  • 5 years of sales-related experience.
  • Proven experience in sales within the IT sector. Ideally, you would have sold or prospected software, cloud, or DevOps solutions.
  • Proficiency in working in various CRM, sales prospecting tools, and web-based conferencing systems e.g MS Office suite, Salesforce.com, Intercom, and Zoom.
  • Ability to comfortably engage with technical buyers and procurement.
  • Great written and oral communication skills for creating professional documents and giving presentations to interested clients.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to listen to concerns and handle criticism.
  • Positive attitude and want to be part of an energetic sales environment.
  • Expertise in conflict resolution.
  • Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions.

 

Working for Cloudsmith

You will be working as part of the core team to help drive more customer adoption with this game-changing technology.

 

The company is growing fast and we are focused on everyone at Cloudsmith to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day. We are driven, focused, and encourage creativity and collaboration.

 

About The Location

We’re based in Belfast, Northern Ireland, but like us and the entire team right now, you’ll be fully remote, with 24/7 access to a BT1 office space. We serve customers in the US and EMEA regions.

 

About Equal Opportunity

We’re an equal opportunities employer that does not discriminate against age, sex, gender, pronouns, race, disability, pregnancy, marital or parental status, political ideology, creed, sexual orientation, religious background, etc. Your ability and passion are infinitely more important to us.

 

Covid 19

Cloudsmith is committed to supporting Covid-19 vaccinations. We encourage our employees and their family members to get vaccinated, as it is the best way to limit the spread of COVID-19 and keep you, your family, our workforce, and communities healthy.

 

Requirements

  • 3-5 years sales related experience in B2B Saas/technology sales

- Prospecting, value-based / consultative selling, using effective discovery questions & identifying relevant customer initiatives

  • Industry knowledge

- DevOps, continuous integration & continuous deployment, containers (eg Docker), container orchestration (eg Kubernetes)

  • University degree (essential)

- Master's degree (or MBA) is desirable

Benefits

For excellent candidates like you, expect an incredible opportunity and compensation

💙 Extremely competitive salary

💙 25 days annual leave + 8 optional public holidays

💙 Birthday Day Off

💙 Remote & Flexible working policies

💙 Health / dental insurance

💙 Great pension contributions (matched up to 8%)

💙 Maternity/Paternity/Adoptive Leave

💙 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Employer

💙 Branded hoodie, t-shirt, socks & swag

💙 Extra perks, like free conference days, or support for additional self-learning

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Over the last ten years, SaaS has changed the way we work — for the better. Slack instead of email. Miro instead of sticky notes. Airtable instead of Excel. SaaS is helping tech companies move so much faster, but it’s also introducing a new surface area of risk they’ve never seen before. The risk of leaking sensitive data. As a result, companies are faced with answering the difficult question of how to manage compounding security risks as they grow without introducing more red tape that slows their team members down.

At Metomic, we help tech companies save time & reduce costs by minimising their sensitive data footprint in cloud applications like Slack, Google Drive and Zendesk.

Our technology includes native integrations with dozens of cloud apps, AI to detect thousands of sensitive data types, and advanced functionality to manipulate data at scale (redaction, retention, access controls, etc). All from one place. This liberates tech companies to make full use of their favourite SaaS apps as they grow, whilst Metomic takes care of all the security risks behind the scenes.

After launching our product in April 2021, we now count some of the world’s most innovative companies as customers, such as Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent, Travelperk and Jumio. Our revenue is growing quickly and we’re backed by some great investors like Connect (investors in CityMapper, Typeform, Marvel), LocalGlobe (Improbable, Figma, Zego) and RFC (Hopin, Clubhouse, On Deck, etc).


 

Our Team

Over the past year, our sales team (now 8 strong!) have taken our product to market and have been iterating our value proposition. We count some of the world’s most innovative companies as customers, such as Jumio, Zego, Clearcover, Omnipresent and TravelPerk. We’re entering a really exciting period in our growth journey and are looking to welcome a new Account Executive to the team to be part of this.

You will be responsible for building relationships with executives and decision-makers (usually CTOs, CIOs and CISOs), gaining a strong understanding of their business needs and priorities, and owning the sales delivery cycle from qualified lead through to onboarding transition with our Customer Success team.

We’ve set ambitious targets as a business and you will have ownership of a personal target each quarter. We’ve invested, and continue to invest, in the best tools on the market for our sales team so you can focus on what matters most.

We take learning and career development seriously and want Metomic to be an environment where you can grow and develop your skills down whatever path you’re most interested in. Some of our sales team have moved into more specialised roles, been promoted to new roles, or taken on people leadership responsibilities. We also have sales learning forums and ‘Revenue Hour’ where we come together as a team to move things forward and invest time in our own upskilling.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop product expertise - You will build your understanding of our product and industry to position yourself as a trusted advisor and expert to our prospects.
  • Build deep rapport and understanding of our customers - You’ll qualify prospective customer pain points with precision & depth, take time to understand their needs, and consider the value our solution can provide them.
  • Own the sales delivery cycle - You’ll be accountable for running our sales cycle from qualified lead through to onboarding transition to the Customer Success team. This will include demoing the product, objection handling, legal negotiation (with support from our legal advisors) and leading our Risk Reviews (our version of a POC).
  • Contribute to our GTM strategy - You’ll work closely with our SDRs to tailor messaging, approach and cadence, and with the wider Sales, Marketing and Leadership team on strategies for growing our presence across the market.

Requirements

  • Demonstrable experience in a B2B SaaS environment - You’ll be familiar and comfortable with the B2B sales cycle and demonstrate a track record of sales and hitting targets.
  • A strong listener who is inquisitive and curious - you’ll be building relationships, asking probing questions, actively listening to pain points and understanding how prospective customers might benefit from Metomic.
  • Very strong written and presentation skills - you’ll be the face and words of Metomic, so you’ll take time to sharpen messaging, pay close attention to details and communicate with impact.
  • Values- and relationship-driven - We’re a small, friendly and tight-knit team and we value kindness and empathy. You’ll own an individual target but also contribute to our sales team culture and team growth.
 
Our recruitment process

We know your time is important and want to make sure our recruitment process provides both of us a really authentic and meaningful insight into what it would be like working together, so we’re planning on the following stages:

  • Intro Call (30 mins) This will focus on your motivations and interests, your journey to date and some of the experiences you’ve had, along with a chance to share more about Metomic and the Sales Team
  • Skills Interview (1 hour) This will focus on your sales experience, decision-making and discuss our sales approach in more detail
  • Practical Interview (1 hour). This will involve a practical activity focused on written communication and presentation skills.
  • Interview with Rich Vibert, CEO (30 mins) - This will be an opportunity to speak with Rich, our CEO and Co-Founder, to learn more about our journey and strategy.

Benefits

Compensation
  • Our range is £45-60k base + Double OTE.
  • Our success is your success, so you’ll receive equity (under our tax-efficient EMI options scheme) as part of our annual grant process.
Life as a Metonaut 👩‍🚀
  • 🏡 Remote Working - We’re remote-friendly and also have a co-working space for those who prefer that.
  • 🏥 Private Health Insurance - Enrolled from Day 1 through Vitality, for when life happens.
  • 🏝 Holiday Leave - 25 days holiday leave, excluding bank holidays.
  • 🎉 Holiday Break - At the end of each year we close for 2 weeks to allow for a meaningful break for our people. This break is fully paid and in addition to Holiday Leave
  • 🎓 Learning Budget - £400 per year to invest in your growth
  • 🖥 WFH Budget - £150 per year to contribute to your home office
  • ✈️ Friendly & Social Team - We have regular team socials both in-person and online, including an annual team trip away (previous years have been in the South of France and Lisbon).
  • 💜 Working Environment - We’re a small, friendly and close-knit team who value kindness, transparency and autonomy to have an impact

#LI-Remote #LI-Hybrid

results.title: Sales & Reporting Analyst
results.description:
Position

Sales & Reporting Analyst

Location

Burlington, MA or remote within New England


About LightForce

LightForce is a 3D printing technology company focused on the orthodontic space. Our digital platform empowers orthodontists with 3D-printed tooth-moving tools. In 2019, we launched our first product - the world's only, fully customized 3D printed bracket system and digital treatment software. We are proud to be one of the fastest growing companies in the industry. Learn more at: www.lf.co

Description

The Analyst will report to the Senior Director of Commercial Operations. This individual will improve, execute, and effectively communicate significant analyses that identify meaningful trends and opportunities across the business. The Analyst will participate in regular meetings with management, assessing and addressing issues to identify and implement improvements toward efficient operations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Prepare, analyze, and summarize various weekly, monthly, and periodic operational results for use by various key stakeholders, creating reports, specifications, instructions, and flowcharts
  • Provide strong and timely financial and business analytic decision support to business partners and various organizational stakeholders
  • Evaluate key performance indicators, provide ongoing reports, and recommend business plan updates
  • Interpret data, analyze results using analytics, research methodologies, and statistical techniques
  • Develop and implement data analyses, leverage data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Conduct full lifecycle of analytics projects, including pulling, manipulating, and exporting data from project requirements documentation to design and execution

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science, mathematics, business management, or economics
  • Minimum of 3+ years' experience
  • Deep experience with managing budgets
  • The ability to present findings in a polished way
  • Proficiency with statistics and dataset analytics (using SPSS, SAS, Excel)
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, with an innovative approach to business planning
  • Valid Driver's license and ability to travel

Attributes

  • Strong work ethic
  • Advanced analytical skills with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy
  • The ability to write reports
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills


Work Schedule/Hours

  • Regular business hours


Physical Demands

  • While performing the essential functions of this job, an individual is regularly required to sit or stand, walk, travel (vehicle and plane), see, use hands and arms, listen, and speak.

Perks

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous premium coverage for medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Fitness and wellness reimbursement program
  • Retirement account
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits program
  • Paid parental leave

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the preferred qualifications described.

LightForce has a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, which requires team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or be approved for a medical or religious exemption with accommodations in order to partake in certain activities in the United States.

LightForce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law

results.title: Inside Sales
results.description:
Company Description

Job Description

Identifying a new opportunity through an ongoing trend to provide marketing opportunities to our clients in a more online and virtual way, we are creating a new high-performance virtual Inside Sales team to work solely from their home office.  We are currently searching for elite selling professionals to join this new team.

We are a looking for highly motivated, self-starters that understand customer-need based, consultative selling and can develop business prospects from multiple sources.  If you are an organized, persistent, and driven sales professional that thrives in a fast-paced environment while working exclusively from home, this role is for you.

The successful candidates will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and generating sales revenue for both print and digital products across select Community markets. Individuals will have the ability to grow existing business, reestablish client relationships and initiate new business using industry leading sales support technologies.

This is an amazing opportunity for anyone interested in being able to work remotely from their home, anywhere in Ontario

 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Working from home developing sales via telephone, virtual and email communications
  • Follow up on inbound leads in line with established expected Service Levels
  • Manage targeted client and prospect lead list and a high volume of client accounts.
  • Conduct a needs analysis to help identify budgets and needs to recommend appropriate  product selections for clients.
  • Work daily with sales tools including CRM and Sales Engagement Platform
  • Build and cultivate client relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel.
  • Track sales pipeline to consistently meet monthly revenue and client acquisition goals.
  • As part of this role, you will be required to handle credit card information. Metroland Media  is a PCI compliant company and requires people in this role to take PCI training to handle cards in a safe and compliant manner.



Qualifications
  • Minimum 1 -3 years of sales experience.  Print and digital media experience an asset.
  • Creative thinker that has a professional, positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed determined sales and activity quotas
  • An expert at getting to the Right Party Contact
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable in using Sales Support digital technology including a CRM system.
  • Highly self-motivated and accountable
